main event: A bright, star-like object with a white center and many red and green lights around the outside was observed hovering above Lake Shelton, Washington for about 20 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared to be traveling away in one direction before fading and disappearing behind trees.
The sighting lasted for approximately 12 minutes.
The observers used binoculars to view the object, which appeared to be a bright light with several smaller lights around it.

The weather conditions at the time were clear with high visibility, and there were reports of an intense brilliance and radiation inversion over the Pacific Northwest that could have reflected lights.
Witnesses stated that the object appeared on 112 consecutive nights in the same location at the same time, making it a possible recurring sighting.
sighted object: a bright, star-like object with a white center and many red and green lights around the outside
witnesses: two unidentified housewives from Lake Stevens, Washington
